id.desc: Component ID, not specified by default. If specified, it can be used to refer the component in option or API.

orient.desc:
The layout orientation of toolbox's icon. Options: 

* 'horizontal'
* 'vertical'

itemGap.desc: The gap between each icon of toolbox. It is horizontal gap in horizontal layout, while vertical gap in vertical layout.

showTitle.desc: Whether to show the title of each tool icon when mouse hovers.

feature.saveAsImage.type.desc:
File suffix of the image saved. 

* If the renderer is set to be 'canvas' when chart [initialized][0] (default), then 'png' (default) and 'jpg' are supported.
* If the renderer is set to be 'svg' when when chart [initialized][0], then only 'svg' is supported for type ('svg' type is supported since v4.8.0).



[0]: api.html#echarts.init

feature.saveAsImage.name.desc:
Name to save the image, whose default value is [title.text][0].

[0]: #title.text

feature.saveAsImage.backgroundColor.desc:
Background color to save the image, whose default value is [backgroundColor][0]. If backgroundColor is not set, white color is used.

[0]: #backgroundColor

feature.saveAsImage.connectedBackgroundC.desc:
When [echarts.connect][0] is used to connect the interaction of multiple chart series, they will all be included in the exported image. This option sets the background color between these charts.

[0]: api.html#echarts.connect

feature.saveAsImage.excludeComponents.desc: Components to be excluded when export. By default, toolbox is excluded.

feature.saveAsImage.icon.desc:
It can be set to an image with 'image://url' , in which URL is the link to an image, or dataURI of an image. An image URL example: 

    'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
    

A dataURI example: 

    'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
    

Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via 'path://' in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.desc: The style setting of save as image icon. Since icon label is displayed only when hovering on the icon, the label configuration options are available under emphasis.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.color.desc:
color. 

> Supports setting as solid color using > rgb(255,255,255)> , > rgba(255,255,255,1)> , > #fff> , etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [> option.color][0]>  for details 

[0]: #color

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderColo.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of color.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderWidt.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0. border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderType.desc:
border type. Possible values are: 

* 'solid'
* 'dashed'
* 'dotted'

Since v5.0.0, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array][0] of the line. With borderDashOffset , we can make the line style more flexible. For example： 

    {
    
    borderType: [5, 10],
    
    borderDashOffset: 5
    }
    



[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderDash.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the line dash offset. With borderType , we can make the line style more flexible. Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderCap.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To specify how to draw the end points of the line. Possible values are: 

* 'butt': The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
* 'round': The ends of lines are rounded.
* 'square': The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is 'butt'. Refer to MDN [lineCap][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderJoin.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet. Possible values are: 

* 'bevel': Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
* 'round': Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
* 'miter': Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the borderMiterLimit property.

Default value is 'bevel'. Refer to MDN [lineJoin][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderMite.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when borderJoin is set as miter. Default value is 10. Negative、0、Infinity and NaN values are ignored. Refer to MDN [miterLimit][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.desc: The style setting of data area zooming icon. Since icon label is displayed only when hovering on the icon, the label configuration options are available under emphasis.

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.color.desc:
color. 

> Supports setting as solid color using > rgb(255,255,255)> , > rgba(255,255,255,1)> , > #fff> , etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [> option.color][0]>  for details 

[0]: #color

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.borderColor.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of color.

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.borderWidth.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0. border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.borderType.desc:
border type. Possible values are: 

* 'solid'
* 'dashed'
* 'dotted'

Since v5.0.0, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array][0] of the line. With borderDashOffset , we can make the line style more flexible. For example： 

    {
    
    borderType: [5, 10],
    
    borderDashOffset: 5
    }
    



[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.borderDashOff.desc:

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.borderCap.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To specify how to draw the end points of the line. Possible values are: 

* 'butt': The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
* 'round': The ends of lines are rounded.
* 'square': The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is 'butt'. Refer to MDN [lineCap][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.borderJoin.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet. Possible values are: 

* 'bevel': Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
* 'round': Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
* 'miter': Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the borderMiterLimit property.

Default value is 'bevel'. Refer to MDN [lineJoin][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin

feature.dataZoom.iconStyle.borderMiterLi.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when borderJoin is set as miter. Default value is 10. Negative、0、Infinity and NaN values are ignored. Refer to MDN [miterLimit][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit

Defines which [xAxis][0] should be controlled. By default, it controls all x axes. If it is set to be false, then no x axis is controlled. If it is set to be then it controls axis with axisIndex of 3. If it is set to be [0, 3], it controls the x-axes with axisIndex of 0 and 3.

feature.dataZoom.yAxisIndex.desc:

> Supports setting as solid color using > rgb(255,255,255)> , > rgba(255,255,255,1)> , > #fff> , etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [> option.color][0]>  for details 

[0]: #color

feature.magicType.iconStyle.borderColor.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of color.

feature.magicType.iconStyle.borderWidth.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0. border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

feature.magicType.iconStyle.borderType.desc:
border type. Possible values are: 

* 'solid'
* 'dashed'
* 'dotted'

Since v5.0.0, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array][0] of the line. With borderDashOffset , we can make the line style more flexible. For example： 

    {
    
    borderType: [5, 10],
    
    borderDashOffset: 5
    }
    



[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray

feature.magicType.iconStyle.borderDashOf.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the line dash offset. With borderType , we can make the line style more flexible. Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset

feature.magicType.iconStyle.borderCap.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To specify how to draw the end points of the line. Possible values are: 

* 'butt': The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
* 'round': The ends of lines are rounded.
* 'square': The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is 'butt'. Refer to MDN [lineCap][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap

feature.magicType.iconStyle.borderJoin.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet. Possible values are: 

* 'bevel': Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
* 'round': Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
* 'miter': Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the borderMiterLimit property.

Default value is 'bevel'. Refer to MDN [lineJoin][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin

feature.magicType.iconStyle.borderMiterL.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when borderJoin is set as miter. Default value is 10. Negative、0、Infinity and NaN values are ignored. Refer to MDN [miterLimit][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit

feature.magicType.iconStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as color.

feature.magicType.iconStyle.shadowOffset.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.
Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

feature.magicType.iconStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

feature.magicType.emphasis.iconStyle.sha.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as color.
Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.
Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

feature.magicType.emphasis.iconStyle.opa.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

feature.magicType.emphasis.iconStyle.tex.desc: Fill color of text. If it's not set, it will use in the order of icon's fill color, stroke color, and '#000'.

feature.magicType.option.desc: Configuration item for each type, which will be used when switching to certain type.

feature.brush.desc:
Brush-selecting icon. It can also be configured at [brush.toolbox][0].

[0]: #brush.toolbox

feature.brush.type.desc:
Icons used, whose values are: 

* 'rect': Enabling selecting with rectangle area.
* 'polygon': Enabling selecting with any shape.
* 'lineX': Enabling horizontal selecting.
* 'lineY': Enabling vertical selecting.
* 'keep': Switching between _single selecting_ and _multiple selecting_. The latter one can select multiple areas, while the former one cancels previous selection.
* 'clear': Clearing all selection.

feature.brush.icon.rect.desc:
It can be set to an image with 'image://url' , in which URL is the link to an image, or dataURI of an image. An image URL example: 

    'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
    

A dataURI example: 

    'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
    

Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via 'path://' in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. [0]: http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData

iconStyle.desc: The style setting of Shared icon. Since icon label is displayed only when hovering on the icon, the label configuration options are available under emphasis.

color.

>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the line dash offset. With borderType , we can make the line style more flexible. Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset

emphasis.iconStyle.borderCap.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To specify how to draw the end points of the line. Possible values are: 

* 'butt': The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
* 'round': The ends of lines are rounded.
* 'square': The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is 'butt'. Refer to MDN [lineCap][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap

emphasis.iconStyle.borderJoin.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet. Possible values are: 

* 'bevel': Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
* 'round': Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
* 'miter': Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the borderMiterLimit property.

Default value is 'bevel'. Refer to MDN [lineJoin][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin

emphasis.iconStyle.borderMiterLimit.desc:
>  Since > v5.0.0 To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when borderJoin is set as miter. Default value is 10. Negative、0、Infinity and NaN values are ignored. Refer to MDN [miterLimit][0] for more details.

[0]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit

emphasis.iconStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as color.

emphasis.iconStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

emphasis.iconStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

emphasis.iconStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

emphasis.iconStyle.textFill.desc: Fill color of text. If it's not set, it will use in the order of icon's fill color, stroke color, and '#000'.

zlevel.desc: zlevel value of all graphical elements in . zlevel is used to make layers with Canvas. Graphical elements with different zlevel values will be placed in different Canvases, which is a common optimization technique. We can put those frequently changed elements (like those with animations) to a separate zlevel. Notice that too many Canvases will increase memory cost, and should be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid crash. Canvases with bigger zlevel will be placed on Canvases with smaller zlevel.

z.desc: z value of all graphical elements in , which controls order of drawing graphical components. Components with smaller z values may be overwritten by those with larger z values. z has a lower priority to zlevel, and will not create new Canvas.

left.desc: Distance between toolbox component and the left side of the container. left value can be instant pixel value like 20; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like '20%'; and it can also be 'left', 'center', or 'right'. If the left value is set to be 'left', 'center', or 'right', then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

top.desc: Distance between toolbox component and the top side of the container. top value can be instant pixel value like 20; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like '20%'; and it can also be 'top', 'middle', or 'bottom'. If the left value is set to be 'top', 'middle', or 'bottom', then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

right.desc: Distance between toolbox component and the right side of the container. right value can be instant pixel value like 20; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like '20%'. Adaptive by default.

bottom.desc: Distance between toolbox component and the bottom side of the container. bottom value can be instant pixel value like 20; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like '20%'. Adaptive by default.

width.desc: Width of toolbox component. Adaptive by default.

height.desc: Height of toolbox component. Adaptive by default.
